And they're searching for prescriptions and and how to's, and they are completely lost and lost and attached to the culture. May I ask a follow-up question? Okay. If you were a serious person that had isolated yourself from society and did what you needed to do to evolve, how would you go about reintegrating yourself to, quote, unquote, fit in once you've already made the necessary time away to evolve? I mean, there's no how to. Firstly, there's no reason to isolate oneself from society. And the reason that that is said is because people are very, very prescriptive in the most clever ways. And so they will isolate themselves from society so that they can does something. And if it's a natural isolation, that's one thing. blocks.text: Hi, Master. Thank you for your time. My question is, basically, I'll give you a quick background. Just growing up, I've I've experienced a good amount of abuse, like, emotional abuse, verbal abuse mainly, and a bit of physical abuse for my father. The physical, I mean, I know it's been anyways, I'm 26 now. The first eighteen years of my life was pretty crappy due to, how he was in the house, and how he treated my mother and all this. And, I guess my question is, I'm 26 now. I'm fairly independent, you know, rather relatively successful product designer in tech and all this stuff. And, you know, I have a talent at it. And I've been listening to your work for I've been reading your work and listening to you for quite some time now. And intellectually, I understand that everything I think about with him about, like, how he treated me in the past and all this. And I still I still think about him daily because me and him really don't speak. We haven't spoken in in about a decade. Well, less than that. And intellectually, I understand that all this memory, all this thought about me and him is all in my mind. And I know it's not really me, and I know it's not really real. This is all just past. And, I guess I'm a little I guess I get frustrated and a little fed up because when I'm alone, like, you know, if I'm driving alone and stuff, this anger comes out of me, and I kind of, you know, manifest in different ways. But it comes kind of against him in a way because of all the unfair treatment and all this stuff. And, again, I understand intellectually this all just fake. A human being does not know why the things that happened to him happened to him To the human being looks at things very simply. Either he looks at things from the standpoint of someone did something to him, or he looks at it from the standpoint of he should forgive. Right. The truth is you don't know why these things happen to you. No human being knows why these things happen to them. The truth is that you live in pain, and you live in suffering because of it. Yeah. So therefore it is not about him. It is about the hesitations that you have to stop blaming him. Therefore, in the end, your greatest problem is an imprisonment by your own ego. The modern day society, has devolved in ways that perhaps nature could not have even predicted. The things that become fashionable in society. Now, if one had a litmus test, and if one if one created an experiment in which whatever society did, they would deny it. One would obviously be well suited to do that experiment on their own and examine the results for themselves. But one thing can be stated for certain, and that is that if one follows society and its fashions and its dogmas, It will ruin their life. And that's why every human being's life is ruined. It has become fashionable to blame parents. It has become fashionable. And it is almost considered shameful to either live with one's parents or speak well of parents. And this is not a surprise because everything that is holy, and everything that is of a divine nature, and everything that is even semi pure, cannot survive in the plastic soil of society. Only false things can survive in society. No human being in a non realized state is perfect. And in every relationship setting, and particularly in the family setting, there are an enormous number of mistakes that are made from all members of the family. And while it can be stated that the children are the most innocent, particularly in the younger years. Truth never lies in blame. And truth does not lie in forgiveness. Truth lies in the understanding that one does not know as much as he or she thinks that they know. And perhaps the most practical truth in the most immediate timeframe is to turn one's back on all of society's fashions. Because society is among the greatest enemies of a human being. And the person who embraces society and its cultures, and its flags, and its way, and its notions, and its concepts will suffer endlessly throughout their life.
